caption.center: BARBARA ANN MAURER, PETITIONER/RESPONDENT, vs. BRIAN KEITH MAURER,

court.center: Missouri Court of Appeals, Eastern District,

opinion.posture: APPEAL FROM THE CIRCUIT COURT OF ST. LOUIS COUNTY.
opinion.attorneys:
Christopher T. Risler, 8000 Maryland Ave., Suite 1000; Clayton, MO 63105, for appellant.
LAW OFFICES OF MARY ANN WEEMS; Mary Ann Weems, 201 S. Central, Suite 309 St. Louis, MO 63105-3508, for respondent.
opinion.panel: Gary M. Gaertner, J. and Mary Rhodes Russell, J.:
opinion.opinion_text:
[1] Brian Keith Maurer appeals from the "JUDGMENT/DECREE OF DISSOLUTION" entered on May 22, 1997 by Family Court Commissioner M. Zane Yates. We dismiss the appeal for lack of jurisdiction.
[2] In Slay v. Slay, 965 S.W.2d 845 (Mo. banc 1998), our Supreme Court decided this Court lacks jurisdiction to consider an appeal from a family court commissioner's purported judgment which was not signed by a judge. See State ex rel. York v. Daugherty,969 S.W.2d 223 (Mo. banc 1998); In re Burnes, 975 S.W.2d 266 (Mo. App. S.D. 1998); Chick v. Chick, 969 S.W.2d 387 (Mo. App. W.D. 1998). In the record before us, we have not found a judgment entered by "a person selected for office in accordance with and authorized to exercise judicial power by article V of the state constitution. . . ." Slay, 965 S.W.2d at 845. Therefore, we lack jurisdiction to consider this appeal because no final, appealable judgment has been entered as required by Rule 74.01.
[3] Appeal dismissed.
